message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.CR 

This paper is about improving the performance of WLANs, which is a topic related to computer networks. Specifically, it focuses on dynamic channel bonding (DCB) and primary channel selection, which are both subtopics of network protocols and algorithms. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). 

The paper also involves some mathematical modeling and optimization, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.IT (Information Theory). Additionally, the authors mention simulation results, which implies that the paper could be relevant to cs.MM (Multimedia). 

Furthermore, the proposed algorithm, DyWi, is described as decentralized and online, which suggests that it could be relevant to cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper discusses the security implications of DCB and primary channel selection, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
